info.title: CE Storefront APIs
info.summary: Customer-facing e-commerce API for building exceptional shopping experiences
info.description: Public-facing API for Commerce Engine storefronts, enabling seamless shopping experiences with product browsing, cart management, checkout processing, user accounts, and order tracking. Perfect for building web, mobile, and headless commerce applications.

post.description: Track event

externalDocs.description: API reference for the track-analytics-event operation

post.description:
This API’s focus is on anonymous users who have not undergone the formal account creation process. These anonymous users are associated with a unique ID, ensuring that even in the absence of a fully realized account, there is a distinct and trackable identity for each user. 
To interact with the system, each anonymous user is issued an access token. This access token plays a dual role in the system: it serves as a means of authenticating the user and it also acts as a tool for authorization, determining what actions the authenticated user is permitted to perform.

message.description: A string containing a descriptive message related to the success or failure of the anonymous user creation or authentication.

success.description: A boolean value indicates the success or failure of the anonymous user operation.`true` for success `false` for failure.

content.description: An object containing the response content.

user.description: Information about the user, including their name, email, profile image, etc.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the get-anonymous-token operation

post.description: The Change Password API is a key feature designed to provide a secure and standardized method for users to update their passwords.

old_password.description: The old password associated with the user's account. This parameter is crucial for verifying the user's identity before allowing a password change.

new_password.description: The new password that the user intends to set for their account. This parameter is necessary for updating the password to enhance account security.

confirm_password.description: A confirmation of the new password.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the change password operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the change-password operation

post.description: The Forgot Password API provides a secure mechanism for users to initiate the password recovery process. This API provides one-time password (OTP) token, which facilitas the resetting of user’s account password.

email.description: A string representing the email address.

phone.description: 10 digit phone number without country code.

country_code.description:
Two-letter code begin with a plus sign prefix that identifies different countries. By default it will be +91 if not provided.
Use this key along with phone. Not necessary for email.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

otp_token.description: A string representing the OTP token which facilitas the resetting of user’s account password.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the forgot-password operation

post.description: Generating a One-Time Password (OTP) typically involves creating a random code that is sent to a user for authentication or verification purposes.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

otp_token.description: A string representing the OTP token.

otp_action.description: This is used for verifying OTP or using subsequent APIs call.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the generate-otp operation

post.description: This API enables users to authenticate into the system using their email address. It provides a secure way for users to Login by verifying their identity through a one-time password (OTP) sent to their email address.

register_if_not_exists.description:
This is used to send OTP to unregistered phone. By default it sends OTP to registered phone only. 
To send OTP to unregistered phone it should be pass with true value like this,
"register_if_not_exists": true

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the Login process.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

otp_token.description: The otp token is a unique code that is used for authentication during the Login process.

otp_action.description: It is used for verifying OTP and using subsequent API call.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the login-with-email operation

post.description: This API endpoint allows users to Login using their password. It requires the following parameters: email/phone and password. Also allows users to securely Login and obtain access and refresh tokens for subsequent API calls.

country_code.description:
Two-letter code begin with a plus sign prefix that identifies different countries. By default it will be +91 if not provided.
Use this key along with phone. Not necessary for email.

password.description: The password associated with the user's account.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the Login process.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

user.description: Information about the user, including their name, email, profile image, etc.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the login-with-password operation

post.description: This API enables users to authenticate into the system using their phone number. It provides a secure way for users to log in by verifying their identity through a one-time password (OTP) sent to their registered phone.

country_code.description: Two-letter code begin with a plus sign prefix that identifies different countries. By default it will be +91 if not provided.

phone.description: 10 digit phone number without country code.

register_if_not_exists.description:
This is used to send OTP to unregistered phone. By default it sends OTP to registered phone only. 
To send OTP to unregistered phone it should be pass with true value like this,
"register_if_not_exists": true

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the Login process.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

otp_token.description: The otp token is a unique code that is used for authentication during the Login/Register process.

otp_action.description: It is used for verifying OTP and using subsequent API call.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the login-with-phone operation

post.description: This API enables users to authenticate into the system using their WhatsApp Number. It provides a secure way for users to Login by verifying their identity through a one-time password (OTP) sent to their WhatsApp Number.

country_code.description: Two-letter code begin with a plus sign prefix that identifies different countries. By default it will be +91 if not provided.

phone.description: 10 digit phone number without country code linked with WhatsApp.

register_if_not_exists.description:
This is used to send OTP to unregistered phone. By default it sends OTP to registered phone only. 
To send OTP to unregistered phone it should be pass with true value like this,
"register_if_not_exists": true

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the Login process.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

otp_token.description: The otp token is a unique code that is used for authentication during the Login process.

otp_action.description: It is used for verifying OTP and using subsequent API call.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the login-with-whatsapp operation

post.description: The Logout User API initiate the logout process for a user. Upon a successful request, the API responds with a confirmation message. If the user is not found or there's an issue with the request, an error response is returned with an appropriate message.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the logout operation

post.description: The Refresh Access Token API is an integral component designed to enhance security and user experience. It enables clients to refresh their access tokens seamlessly, extending user sessions without compromising security.

refresh_token.description: A string representing the refresh token.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the refresh-token operation

post.description:
The API allows users to register with their email address. This endpoint enables the registration process by requesting the user's email, first name, last name, phone number.
The response will include a message indicating the success or failure of the registration process, as well as additional information such as the user's information, access token and refresh token.

email.description: A string representing the email address.

first_name.description: A string representing the first name.

last_name.description: A string representing the last name.

phone.description: A string representing the phone number.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the Registration process.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the register-with-email operation

post.description:
The User Registration with Password API facilitates user onboarding by allowing registration through a combination of phone number and email. API collects essential registration details, including phone number, email, password and the confirmation of the chosen password.
The response will include a message indicating the success or failure of the registration process, as well as additional information such as the user's information, access token and refresh token.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the Registration process.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

access_token.description: It is a string-based token utilized for authentication and authorization.

refresh_token.description: It is a string-based token designed for refreshing the user's access token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the register-with-password operation

post.description: The Profile Image API streamlines the process of uploading profile images associating with user accounts, offering a user-centric approach to visual identity customization. Upon success, the API responds with a confirmation message. In case of errors, clear error messages facilitate quick issue resolution. Overall, the Profile Image API enhances user engagement by seamlessly integrating personalized visual elements into digital platforms.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the add operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

profile_image_url.description: A string representing the URL to a profile image.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the add-profile-image operation

put.description: The Profile Image API streamlines the process of updating profile images associating with user accounts, offering a user-centric approach to visual identity customization. Upon success, the API responds with a confirmation message. In case of errors, clear error messages facilitate quick issue resolution. post.description: The Check Verification Status API allows to verify the status of email and phone number verification for a specific user. Upon a successful request, the API responds with the verification status of the provided email and phone number. If the user is not found or there's an issue with the request, an error response is returned with an appropriate message.

phone.description: A string representing the phone number.

email.description: A string representing the email address.

message.description: A descriptive message confirming the success or failure of the operation.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful or failure (true for success, false for failure).

content.description: An object containing the response content.

verified_phone.description: An array containing verified phone numbers for the user

verified_email.description: An array containing verified email address for the user.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the check-verification-status operation

post.description: This API endpoint allows you to verify a one-time password (OTP) for authentication purposes. By sending a request to this endpoint with the necessary parameters, you can confirm the validity of the OTP provided by the user.

otp.description: A string representing the one-time password.

otp_token.description: A string representing the OTP token.

otp_action.description: A string indicating the action to be performed.

message.description: A string providing additional information about the response.

success.description: A boolean indicating whether the operation was successful or not.

content.description: An object containing the response content.

access_token.description: A string representing the access token.

refresh_token.description: A string representing the refresh token.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the verify-otp operation

get.description: Returns a list of your product categories. The categories are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created categories appearing first.

parameters.description: return child categories up to nesting level

parameters.description: To return child categories using category id.

parameters.name: parent_category_slug
parameters.description: To return child categories using category slug

get.description:
The Virtual Payment Address or VPA is a unique ID given to an individual using the Unified Payment Interface (UPI) service to send or receive money. In the case of UPI collect VPA is the mandatory param and merchants are always advised to check if the VPA is valid or not.
Validating the VPA will help in reducing the failure rate due to incorrect vpa.

Cart.description: This cart model is structured to capture a wide range of details, facilitating accurate representation and management of user shopping carts in an e-commerce platform.

active.description: Indicates whether the cart is currently active or inactive.

customer_note.description: customer note for shipping or product customization.

is_promotion_applied.description: Indicates if a promotion is applied or not.

is_coupon_applied.description: Indicates if a coupon is applied or not.

coupon_discount_amount.description: Discount amount due to the coupon.

coupon_discount_percent.description: Discount amount due to the coupon.

promotion_discount_amount.description: Discount amount due to promotions(If Applied).

promotion_discount_percent.description: Discount amount due to promotions(If Applied).

subtotal.description: Subtotal amount for items in the cart.

shipping_discount_amount.description: Discount applied on estimated shipping cost.

shipping_tax_rate.description: Shipping tax rate applied on shipping amount.

handling_charge_excluding_tax.description: The additional charge applied to cover the costs associated with processing, packaging, and handling an order. This fee is separate from shipping charges and may include materials, or special handling requirements.

total_tax.description: Total tax amount for the entire cart.

grand_total.description: Grand total amount for the cart.

to_be_paid.description: Amount to be paid by the customer.

cart_items_count.description: Number of items in the cart.

cart_items.description: List containing detailed information about each item in the cart.

currency.description: Details about the currency being used, including `name`, `code`, and `symbol`.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the cart.

expires_at.description: the expiration timestamp of the shopping cart. .

applied_promotions.description: Information about the promotional offers that have been applied to the cart.

applied_coupons.description: This key provides details about the savings in cart after coupon have been applied to the cart.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the Cart schema

Cart.title: Cart

externalDocs.description: API reference for the CartBasedServiceabilityCheck schema

CartItem.description: This Cart Item model captures the attributes of a cart item, including product details, pricing information, subscription details, and other relevant information related to Cart Item.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit, a unique identifier for the product within inventory.

product_image_url.description: URL pointing to the product image.

stock_available.description: Indicates whether the product is currently in stock.

backorder.description: Indicates whether the item is being fulfilled as a backorder. When true, the item is not currently in stock and will ship later once inventory is available. This may result in the order being split into multiple shipments, with delays for the backordered portion.

on_offer.description: Indicates whether the product is currently on offer.

on_subscription.description: Indicates whether the product is currently on a subscription.

on_promotion.description: Indicates whether the product is part of a promotion.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product in the cart.

is_free_item.description: Indicates if the product is offered for free.

free_quantity.description: Quantity of the product that is free.

coupon_discount_amount.description: Discount amount due to applied coupons.

handling_charge_excluding_tax.description: Additional cost for shipping associated with the product.

handling_charge_tax_rate.description: Additional cost for shipping associated with the product.

handling_charge_including_tax.description: Additional cost for shipping associated with the product.

tax_rate.description: The rate of tax applied to the product.

tax_amount.description: The total tax amount for the product.

options.createMandate.description: Use for taking consent of subscription payments. If this key is used it will ask user to give consent for subscription payment.

mandate.maxAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be charged in recurring payment.

mandate.rule_value.description:
When frequency is passed as WEEKLY, FORTNIGHTLY, MONTHLY, BIMONTHLY, QUARTERLY, HALFYEARLY, or YEARLY then is it required that the exact day of the period should be passed.

1-7 when frequency is WEEKLY. In weekly, serial numbers start from Monday. Monday represents 1 and Sunday represents 7.

1-16 when frequency is FORTNIGHTLY. This mandate is executed twice a month. First day of the month is represented by value '1' and ends with '15' on 15th day of the month. Then again starts with '1' for 16th of the month and ends with the last day of the month.

1-31 when frequency is MONTHLY, BIMONTHLY, QUARTERLY, HALFYEARLY, or YEARLY.

si.description:
To be used in case we want to take consent for subscription payment.
To create consent for subscription, value of this parameter must be 1.

si_details.description: Send this json object for creating subscription consent.

billingAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be charged in recurring payment.

billingInterval.description:
Billing Interval is closely coupled with the billingCycle field and denotes at what frequency, the subscription plan needs to be executed. For monthly subscriptions, parameter values need to be sent in the request are:
billingCycle = MONTHLY
billingInterval = 1
Similarly, by keeping the following values, customer will be charged once in every 3 days:
billingCycle = DAILY
billingInterval = 3

furl.description: return url in case of payment failure.

surl.description: return url in case of payment success.

stock_available.description: Indicates whether the product has stock available

backorder.description: Indicates whether the item is being fulfilled as a backorder. When true, the item is not currently in stock and will ship later once inventory is available. This may result in the order being split into multiple shipments, with delays for the backordered portion.

on_offer.description: Indicates whether this item is associated with any active (product-specific) coupons

on_subscription.description: Indicates whether the product has any subscription plans avaialble

on_promotion.description: Indicates whether the product is currently on promotion. When true, the `ProductPromotion` object will contain details of the promotion

has_variant.description: Indicates whether the product has variants

variant_options.description: this will be used if has_variant is true, to auto set default values.

rating.description: The rating of the product review. Must be in rang 1-5 (multiple of 0.5)

review_text.description: The text for the product review.

email.description: The email of the reviewer. Must be a valid email, or an empty string.

status.description: Reviews with approved status will be displayed.

review_date.description: The ISO 8601 date-time for when review was first submitted or last modified by the original submitter.

created_at.description: The ISO 8601 date-time for when review is created.

modified_at.description: The ISO 8601 date-time for when review was last modified.

billing_interval.description: Billing interval determines the frequency for which the customer is charged for the subscription itself.

billing_limit.description: Optionally limit the number of times this subscription will invoice the customer.

order_interval.description: order interval defines the frequency of when the subscription sends customers the product

order_limit.description: By default this is set to unlimited, meaning the subscription will fulfill indefinitely. Changing the Limit to 10 would force the subscription to end after the tenth interval had been fulfilled.

minimum_quantity.description: The quantity of the plan to which the customer should be subscribed

billing_trial_days.description: Use in digital product only for trial period

limit.description: Maximum number of records returned for a page.

facets.description:
provide list of attributes for specific facets or * for all facets.
```json
For specific facets: ["size", "color", "brand"]
```
```json
For all facets: ["*"]
```

content_title.description: to be used in email subject or notification heading if provided.

externalDocs.description: API reference for the StoreTemplate schema

price.description: The subscription price is the amount a customer is required to pay over a specified period (e.g., monthly, annually). This price may vary based on the plan selected or based on usage of services.

end_date.description: if specified, subscrition will be revoked on this date.

trial_days.description: If specified, payment will be charged after trial days completed.

billing_interval.description: Frequency unit multiplier. For example, `1` with `monthly` means every month; `3` with `weekly` means in every 3 weeks.

shipping_interval.description: Frequency unit multiplier. For example, `1` with `monthly` means every month; `3` with `weekly` means in every 3 weeks.

coupon_redemption_limit.description: Indicates how many times a coupon can be redeemed within the subscription.

is_prepaid.description: Indicates whether the subscription is paid in advance. When set to true, the subscription requires the customer to pay for the entire billing period upfront. When set to false, the subscription may operate on a pay-as-you-go or post-paid model, where charges are billed after the service is provided.

usage_based_billing.description: Refers to a pricing model where customers are charged based on their actual usage of a service. Usage based billing works for digital products.

usage_based_tiers.description: Refers to a pricing structure where customers are charged based on their usage, but the cost per unit of usage decreases or changes as they move into higher usage levels.

grace_period_days.description: The number of days after a failed payment to retry before canceling.

is_cancellation_allowed.description: Indcates whether the next billing cancellation is allowed or not.

days_until_cancellation_allowed.description: Specifies the number of days the customer has to cancel before the next billing.

currency.description: Details about the currency being used, including `name`, `code`, and `symbol`.

product_id.description: The ID of the product to update in the cart.

variant_id.description: The ID of the product variant, or null if the product has no variants.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product to add to or update in the cart. Use `0` to remove the item from the cart.

CustomerGroupId.name: x-customer-group-id
CustomerGroupId.description: This param is used to determine product pricing, promotions, and subscription rates.  If a valid customer group id is provided, pricing details will be retrieved accordingly.  If no matching data is found for the specified customer group id, the system will fall back to the default customer group id.  If no data is found for the default group either, the highest applicable price will be returned.
